Reason: The configuration 'compaction_large_partition_warning_threshold_mb' is not performance-sensitive. Although it helps in identifying and logging large partitions during compaction, it does not directly and substantially affect system performance at the system level. The configuration does not involve any time-extensive or memory-extensive operations within its related code that lead to notable performance variations. It simply triggers a warning message based on a specified threshold, which does not have a significant impact on system performance.
